_header: A babe is born our bliss to bring
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1.
Subjects: dialogues, Virgin and Christ; Virgin Mary
_description: A dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her Child — eleven quatrains (aaab) plus burden (cc): ‘Now synge we with angelis / Gloria in excelsis’

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
A babe is born our blysse to bryngea maide ther was dyd lully and
                    synge…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…[ ]handys or feet that I sholde lappebe battled so sore that
                    neuer dyd I mys…
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble. 
             “New Stanzas by Dunbar.” 
             “Modern Language Notes” 
         24 (1909): 110-11: 225.

OxfBal354.First Lines:
A babe is born to blys vs bryngeI hard a mayd lulley &
                    synge…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…& syng by by lulley lulleyTo put a way all
                    hevynesExplicit

Har25258.First Lines:
There is a child born to our blessing shall bring:I heard a maid
                    ‘lullo by lollo’ to sing…
Har25258.Last Lines:
… Now sing we both more or less,And welcome be this Merry
                    ChristmasNow sing we, and now sing we,‘To the gloria O tibi,
                    Domini.’
